learning_outcomes.description: Use psychological concepts and principles to solve practical problems in organisation projects;
Demonstrate practical skills in the business environment to diagnose analyse and provide solutions to organisational problems;
Understand and demonstrate professional practice and behaviour as a business consultant within an organisational context acting legally ethically and professionally at all times;
Communicate effectively with project stakeholders (eg., clients managers supervisors and other professionals and colleagues).

assessments.due_date: 1 week after placement starts and final version 1 week after completes
assessments.task_description:
At the beginning of the project, student must put together a project plan according to the set proforma to detail the scope of the project to be undertaken. The project plan outlines the proposed intervention and deliverables, the research and data gathering to be undertaken, the diagnostics to be undertaken, and what issues are in and out of scope and a timeline.  As the project placement progresses the project plan will be updated to include status reports (stage gates) towards the project deliverables, risks, blockers, and the planned intervention and evaluation. The project plan (completed) must accompany the project report at the end of the placement (initial plan due 1 week after the first day on placement - full report due with Project Report).



In the case of ongoing placement agreements the student must also complete a scoping report at the commenncement of placement that provides an overview of the project to be undertaken and the relevant dates and timelines.. this scoping document then becomes the student/organisation agreement

assessments.task_description:
The project report  details to both the organisation and the university the work undertaken and the results achieved. It complements the project plan details what occurred at each step in the project, including outcomes, process, rationale, risks, blockers and issues, costings, resources and timelines. It details the final recommendations and and any artefacts developed and is individual in form and content for each student. 



Some placements may not provide opportunities for all the elements of a project report. The project report can detail those areas of the project process undertaken as part of the end to end process. Example elements in the project report could include:summary of the project or placement, goals, stakeholders, analysis and diagnostics undertaken, strategies adopted and rationale for strategies, strengths and weaknesses of the project or placement, project or placement outcomes and project logistics( including costing timelines and resources) 



One of the projects will become a major project with a major report due as part of the assessment. The project must have elements of a literature review collection and analysis of date and a form of intervention/recommendation

learning_activities.learning_period: Multiple weeksFrom Week 1 To Week 8(01 Dec - 01 Feb)
learning_activities.topic:
Group Mentoring

To support and complement work projects, there will be an on-campus component of each Business psychology project enrolment. As some of the placements will be in organisations where the line supervisor may not have any psychology background and may not be able to support the student in some areas of skills development, these sessions will provide skills support and involve
ﾕ Group coaching and mentoring sessions to support the student with work projects ﾖ provide additional input and discuss alternatives options and approaches for the project.
ﾕ Sharing and discussion with other students of their projects and understanding other work projects
ﾕ Guest speakers from business providing special topic seminars
ﾕ An opportunity to develop further practical skills or in some cases certification eg., ﾓproject managementﾔ.


Learning outcomes: L01, L02, L03, L04
